div.p: ANTONIO: So, if I've progressed to the point of addiction, and I've got all these things going on... what are my options?
FROSTY: Well, one option is to continue using. Another option would be to begin abstaining, in which case I have an opportunity to regain some of the things I value most in life.
EJNA: So, if I'm in the Red Phase, I can seek help, stop my use, and put my life back together. It can be very difficult, but millions of people have done it.
ANTONIO: But people often need help.
EJNA: They do. And they do because the brain changes. These are powerful changes that create both the psychological dependence and the physical addiction.

EJNA: So when somebody enters into recovery early on, it's just about clearing the body of the alcohol or drugs. But then long-term recovery can begin, and that is when people can start reversing the brain changes that have occured.

FROSTY: But of course, this process is going to take time. Many people in the Red Phase are going to need some professional support as well as a lot of help from the people around them in order to succeed.
FROSTY: But if I'm in the Red Phase, I can find support for recovery through Alcoholics Anonymous, Narcotics Anonymous, and other support groups.
ANTONIO: There's so much to think about. We've digested a lot of information about the progression. At this point-- what would you want people to remember most about the phases?
EJNA: Well one important thing is that for different people, or different drugs, the trigger level can actually be higher or lower than we've illustrated.
EJNA: So, for some people, the progression from high-risk choices into addiction could actually happen more quickly if their trigger level is lower, or if they're using a more addictive substance.
FROSTY: And once I am in the Red Phase, the only low-risk choice that remains for me is total abstinence--because the progression at this point is irreversible.
FROSTY: For anybody who has not yet crossed their trigger level, the progression is reversible, so long as they make a commitment to following their low-risk guidelines.

FROSTY: So when you think about it, people in the Orange Phase are at a particularly critical point in their lives, because if they do not return to the Green Phase through low-risk choices, by default they progress to the Red Phase.
